relation: Categories
Campus Safety
Greek Life
Clubs and Activities
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
Bang for the buck
What to do for fun
Food and Dining
Dorm Life
Academic Rigor
Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments

there are multiple emergency buttons through out campus. if you feel threatened in anyway you puch the button and tell the operator the problem. there is also campus police located in the center of campus and they are on the spot when they are needed.

there are always greek parties and the sororities and fraternities are always looking for new recruits. there is no hazing and all of the houses are generally friendly and are willing to work with you academically and financially.
i am always hearing about different clubs and spoorts to get involved in and all of the teams are always welcoming new members weather it be varsity or intramural.

there is a spot by the library where if you stand in the middle and clap it sounds like a bird chirping. there is another legend that says that there is a room in cromwell hall where a girl jumped out the window a few years ago and it is said that she still haunts the whole tenth floor especially that room.

depending on your major your tuition is pretty high. as of fall of 2012 the housing prices are increasing by 200 dollars. the financial aid office is almost always busy so if you want to talk to them you must take out a lot of time in your day.
on campus there is not much to do. if you go off campus there is a bowling alley, hookah bar, mall, walmart, and other various stores.
the food in the freshman dorms as well as the lincoln quads and other areas are very good. we have the commons which has a few fast food places. our dining halls have very friendly faculty.

the dorm life is fun. you will make a ton of new friends and the apa and ra are there to a) apa will help you with homework and b) the ra is there to guide you in where places are they will settle any arguments in the buildings.
academic advisors are always willing to help you when ever they are avaliable. the professors as well are willing to help when they are avaliable to those students who put forth the effort.
in the academic life you must prevail. if you even slack in the slightest bit you will get onto probation or worse dismissed.
it is a friendly environment. the teachers don't assign heavy loads of homework. it is easy to get everywhere.
pageTitle: Indiana State University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {551623=I rate this so low because ISU is a very crowded place. Starting Spring 2014, they raffle off dorm rooms by lottery. Freshmen are guaranteed housing their first semester, but the rest of the student body may be left to find off campus housing., 253595=Terre Haute is a small close-knit community with plenty of activities. In town, there are sporting events, concerts, and festivals. Some events are free and are in walking distance from campus. Just a few miles north of Terre Haute is the home of the 4th largest festival in the United States -- the Parke County Covered Bridge Festival every October, although festival dates may be in conflict with Homecoming festivities., 172847=we march through the fountain., 244725=We currently do not have all black sororities on campus. But in the Fall of 2012 the AKA's and Delta's will be back on campus. I will plan on joining the a sorority in the FALL of 2012., 585779=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 185618=depending on your major your tuition is pretty high. as of fall of 2012 the housing prices are increasing by 200 dollars. the financial aid office is almost always busy so if you want to talk to them you must take out a lot of time in your day., 130668=Apply in September it is free to apply then., 204048=If you are in the freshman dorms and its August plan for it be a hot semester. You cannot ask for a better location at the same time if you are in the towers., 122081=If you are considering coming to Indiana State, here's a few tips I think you may find very useful. During the process of choosing your meal plan, I would advise you choose the Blue Plan. It comes with over 1300 credits and almost $300 in Commons Cash. I highly recommend this plan because it provides you with this amount every semester and you have less of a chance of being broke when the end of the semester approaches. Also, try to avoid getting into fights. Although sometimes it hurts to walk away from a fight, you must realize that your future is at stake. Also, try attending some of the campus activities. If you attend them, there's a good chance you'll be coming out of it with a new shirt, a new water bottle, or some very unique gadget!, 245205=I am also in an organization call Sister's TOO, it is a nice organization for young female. Currently it is an all black organization, but we are trying to expand it for all female on ISU campus, for the FALL 2012. We do many different activities like community service, pool parties, STD's/Safe Sex meetings and etc., 495718=We have a beautiful fountain located in the center of campus. All freshmen also take part in the March Through the Arch during their first weekend on campus.}

textAfterTable: Am enjoying being here My first semester was kind of bad but with the help of new friends I really have enjoyed being here. I helped to create something new to the campus to help keep the students out of the alcohol scene. We created the late night challenge. We took different things and pitted a representative from each floor against each other. One was a hot dog eating challenge after the famous Nathans challenge. It started out small but at the end of the year we had backing from the student organization for pizza and soft drinks for everyone attending and to purchase the supplies for the challenges.This helped to break the newness of being away from home for a lot of the freshmen attending. I am really looking forward to my next year here at Indiana State to tackle new challenges. Am learning a lot I started last year with the intentions of being a physical therapists and was really looking forward to the challenges. Unfortunately being away from home for the first time and the hard class schedule put me behind fairly quickly. As a freshman you are given course classes instead of gen ed classes because they only have a certain amount of space for the classes later on and this is their way of weeding out the students who
